title: Willem Stapelberg
text:
Willem Pieter Stapelberg (born 29 January 1947) is a former South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. 
Playing career.
A police detective by profession, Stapelberg played provincial rugby for <a href="Blue%20Bulls">Northern Transvaal</a> and was a member of the <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> winning teams in <a href="1968%20Currie%20Cup">1968</a>, <a href="1973%20Currie%20Cup">1973</a> and <a href="1974%20Currie%20Cup">1974</a>.
Stapelberg toured with the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a> to France in 1974 and made his test debut against <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> on 23 November 1974 in <a href="Toulouse">Toulouse</a>. He played in both test matches on the French tour, scoring a try in each match. He also played in four tour matches and scored one further try for the Springboks.
Accolades.
Stapelberg was named one of the five SA Rugby players of the Year for 1974. The four other players named, were three members of the <a href="1974%20British%20Lions%20tour%20to%20South%20Africa">1974 British Lions</a> team that toured South Africa, namely <a href="Gareth%20Edwards">Gareth Edwards</a>, <a href="Willie%20John%20McBride">Willie John McBride</a> and <a href="JPR%20Williams">JPR Williams</a> as well as the South African lock forward, <a href="John%20Williams%20%28South%20African%20rugby%20union%29">John Williams</a>.
